post.title: TFS2012 to TFS2013
post.author: abelgaxiola
post.excerpt: After unsuccessfully trying to copy a TFS2012 project repository (and history) into a TFS2013 repository using Visual Studio 2013 and TFS Explorer I decided to try a different approach. This is what I did
post.content:
After unsuccessfully trying to copy a TFS2012 project repository (and history) into a TFS2013 repository using Visual Studio 2013 and TFS Explorer I decided to try a different approach.  This is what I did – and what worked – after some research and plenty of trial and error:

Notes: where you see Server2012 or Server2013 substitute with the URL for your respective servers and collections.  The same goes for the words Branch2012 or Branch2013.  The 2012collection and 2013collection are the collections where the source is hosted; and the 2012source and 2013source are the names of the folders that contain the source code and supporting files.

1.  Opened VS2013 Source Control Explorer
2.  Connected to TFS2013
3.  Created a new folder inside TFS2013 for hosting my migrated code.
         Ended up looking like this: $/2013collection/2013source
4.  Opened a web browser and connected to TFS2012 server.
         The URL looked something like this: http://sptfs:8080/tfs/2012collection...
5.  Selected the project repository that I wanted to copy.
6.  Copied the path to the clipboard (full path shown below).
         $/2012Collection/2012source
7.  Opened a command prompt and executed the following commands:
8.  C:\>md TempFolder
9.  C:\>cd TempFolder
10. C:\ TempFolder>git-tfs clone [Server2012] [Branch2012]
11. C:\TempFolder>cd Branch2013
12. C:\ TempFolder\ Branch2013>git-tf configure [Server2013] [Branch2013]
13. C:\ TempFolder\ Branch2013>git-tf checkin –deep
14. Opened a web browser and connected to TFS2013 server.
15. Navigated to the Code section and verified that the files and history were there.
16. Refreshed VS2013 Source Control Explorer and verified that the files were there.
17. Deleted the C:\>TempFolder and all its contents.

Server2012: http://sptfs:8080/tfs/2012collection
Branch2012: $/RootFolder/2012source
Server2013: http://sdtfs:8080/tfs/2013collection
Branch2013: $/RootFolder/2013source

The following blog post helped by pointing me in the right direction:
blog.simontimms.com/2013/04/02/importing-a-git-repository-into-tfs
Additional Notes: I installed Git-tf and Git-tfs using Chocolatey.  You can check it out here: https://chocolatey.org/
